instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message:
This arrived fully functional. User wanted their drive erased and a new OS installed.

Booted into OS recovery mode and erased the SSD. During the erase process the screen went black but then nothing else happened. Normally it would turn back on and start internet recovery process.

When trying a DFU restore apple configurator2 keeps giving error message

“The system cannot be restored on this device” unexpected device state DFU expected recovery (probably forced into DFU mode externally” (4014


how do you fix this kind of problem?

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message: Check if SSD gets all voltages.

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message:
The issue recently got worse.

After taking board out of the case its now stuck at 5V 0 amp

0V PP3V3 and 0V PPBUS_G3H no shorts.

Tried a new ISL9240 but no change

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H is only 0.160V

Tried new isl9240 but no change. Not shorted either.

Any ideas?

Having difficulty finding where to measure SSD voltages. 01521board view for SSD voltage locations much different then this one

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message:
pp0v9_ssd appears to be missing but the schematic does not tell me from where it comes from.

On another board that has ticking CPU this rail jumps to 0.160V at times. The one are working on stays at 0V

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at 0V9_SSD, if missing.
It is generated by U7800 (PMIC).

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message: 0.472 diode

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message:
So the Apple Configurator 2 tells you machine is in Recovery mode?
We have few recent posts about switching to DFU in such case.

Did you follow all the steps from DFU tutorial?

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message: No Apple configuator 2 rcognizes the machine in DFU mode, starts the restore process then gives the following error. See attached picture

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message: Can't read anything there...

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message: Try this

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message: Check if all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are stable.

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message:
PP1V2_AWAKE 1.2V

PP1V8_AWAKE 1.8V

PP3V3_AWAKE 3.3v

PPVDDCPU_AWAKE 0.755v

PPVDDCPUSRAM_AWAKE 0.802v

PP0V8_SLPS2R 0.800v

PP1V8_SLPS2R 1.8v

PP1V25_SLPS2R_SMC_AVREF 0.234v

PP1V1_SLPS2R 1.1v

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message:
"PP1V25_SLPS2R_SMC_AVREF 0.234v"
There is a problem.
Check diode mode to ground.
Remove C4781 and check voltage again.
If still low, change U4780.

Just in case, try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message:
After removing and replacing C4781 PP1V25_SLPS2R_SMC_AVREF is now a steady 1.1V

afterwards tried DFU restore once again which finished successfully but the board is still having a boot problem. When plugging in it would go up to 0.78 amps the fan would spin real fast then would go back to 0amps andkept repeating that process.

Tried DFU restore once again but it’s now giving me that same 4014 error along with a new error at times I’ve attached.

What next?

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message:
After many attempts apple configurator 2 successfully restored the t2 firmware.

Now when power is applied it goes to 20v and up to 0.78amps before cycling back to 0 and repeat. Fan spins for a few seconds during this process

What should be checked next for the looping problem?

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message:
PP1V8_SSD 1.8V

PP0V9_SSD 1.054V

PP2V7_NAND 2.5V

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message:
After restore is done, the T2 Mac should start macOS installation.

Try again to start in SMC bypass mode.
Check voltage on big coils when fan spins.

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message:
SMC bypass mode did not work.

Voltages on all big coils are good.

After the fan spins meter stays at 0.63 amps for a few seconds then drops to 0amps. Afterwards only goes up to 0.14amps back to 0amps and so on up until charger disconnected

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message: After amps drop to 0 L8100 remains at 0V as the board cycles.. Could that be a bad Q8100 even though it goes up to 1.1V when charger first plugged in?

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message: Try connecting battery (known good) and charger at same time.

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message: Already did, and same type of behavior happens except amp draw a little higher.

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message:
Good battery resolved that problem.

Once the board is powered up the apple logo appears for several minutes (normally only appears a few seconds) and once  internet recovery mode begins there is a another long delay before givin the option to choose wifi network. Trackpad cursor moves all over on its own. Click not working but caps light on keyboard works. Tried known good trackpad and keyboard but same behavior.

L6700 was replaced just in case  but no change

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message: Did you change trackpad flex?

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message: yes

threads.title: 820-01958 DFU problems
threads.message:
Try again DFU restore.
Clean trackpad flex and MLB connector.
Test with another battery and charger.
